qas.question: What was the Eritrean region known as during the Middle Ages?
When was Eritrea annexed by Ethiopia?
When did the Eritrean Liberation Front form?
What was the Roman name for the Red Sea?
In what year did the Eritrean Liberation Front cease operations?
In what year was Italian Eritrea founded?
What was Ethiopia known as during the Middle Ages?

context: During the Middle Ages, the Eritrea region was known as <a0_0><b4_0>Medri Bahri<b4_0/><a0_0/> ("sea-land"). The name Eritrea is derived from the ancient Greek name for Red Sea (Ἐρυθρὰ Θάλασσα Erythra Thalassa, based on the adjective ἐρυθρός erythros "red"). It was first formally adopted in <b6_0><b7_0>1890<b7_0/><b6_0/>, with the formation of <b8_0>Italian Eritrea<b8_0/> (Colonia Eritrea). The territory became the Eritrea Governorate within Italian East Africa in 1936. Eritrea was annexed by Ethiopia in <a1_0>1953<a1_0/> (nominally within a federation until 1962) and an Eritrean Liberation Front formed in <a2_0>1960<a2_0/>. Eritrea gained independence <a3_0>following the 1993 referendum<a3_0/>, and the name of the new state was defined as State of Eritrea in the <b5_0>1997<b5_0/> constitution.[citation needed]
